TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit NetNamedPipeBinding extends System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding implements class System.ServiceModel.Channels.IBindingRuntimePreferences

Docs.summary: Provides a secure and reliable binding that is optimized for on-machine communication.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The NetNamedPipeBinding generates a run-time communication stack by default, which uses transport security, named pipes for message delivery, and a binary message encoding. This binding is an appropriate [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/add/includes/indigo1-md.md)] system-provided choice for on-machine communication. It also supports transactions.
The default configuration for the NetNamedPipeBinding is similar to the configuration provided by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding>, but it is simpler because the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/indigo2-md.md)] implementation is only meant for on-machine use and consequently there are fewer exposed features. The most notable difference is that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode> setting only offers the <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode> options. SOAP security support is not an included option. The security behavior is configurable using the optional `securityMode` parameter in <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeSecurityMode%29> the constructor.
## Examples The following example shows the part of the configuration file that contains the section for the NetNamedPipeBinding with values set to defaults.
The following example shows how to programmatically use the NetNamedPipeBinding class.
[!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.servicemodel.ne_5_2.cs)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The default security mode used is <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeSecurityMode>.
## Examples The following example shows the part of the configuration file that contains the section for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeBinding> with values set to defaults.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeSecurityMode securityMode) cil managed

Docs.param: The value that specifies whether Windows security is used with named pipes.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified security mode.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor when you want to configure the security explicitly. The default is <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetNamedPipeSecurityMode> when using the default constructor.
## Examples [!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/9da2bbae-469d-4db2-8f3a-_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets the version of SOAP that is used for messages processed by this binding.

remarks.format:

## Examples The following example shows how to get the version of SOAP.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the hostname is used to reach the service when matching the URI.
Docs.value: The value that indicates whether the hostname is used to reach the service when matching the URI. The default value is , which ignores the hostname in the match.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to get the HostNameComparisonMode property.
[!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#13](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ne_30_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of bytes that are used to buffer incoming messages in memory.
Docs.value: The maximum number of bytes that are used to buffer incoming messages in memory. The default value is 524,288 bytes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you receive more data than you can buffer, the data that exceeds the buffer size remains on the underlying socket until your buffer has room for the rest of the data.
## Examples The following example shows how to get the MaxBufferPoolSize value.
[!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ne_6_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of bytes used to buffer incoming messages in memory.
Docs.value: The maximum number of bytes that are used to buffer incoming messages in memory. The default value is 65,536 bytes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you receive more data than you can buffer, the data that exceeds the buffer size remains on the underlying socket until your buffer has room for the rest of the data.
## Examples The following example shows how to get the MaxBufferSize value.
[!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ne_17_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: The value set is less than 0.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of connections, both inbound and outbound, that are allowed to endpoints configured with the named pipe binding.
Docs.value: The maximum number of named pipe connections that are allowed with this binding. The default value is 10.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The maximum number of inbound and the maximum number of outbound connections are set to the same value.
## Examples The following example shows how to get the MaxConnections values.
[!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ne_26_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size, in bytes, for a received message that is processed by the binding.
Docs.value: The maximum size (in bytes) for a received message that is processed by the binding. The default value is 65,536 bytes.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to get the MaxReceivedMessageSize value.
[!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ne_27_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets constraints on the complexity of SOAP messages that can be processed by endpoints configured with this binding.
Docs.value: The that specifies the complexity constraints on SOAP messages exchanged. The default values for these constraints are provided in the following Remarks section.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The complexity constraints protect against a class of denial of service (DOS) attacks that attempt to use message complexity to tie up endpoint processing resources. The properties that express these constraints and their default values are as follows:
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxDepth%2A> = 32
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxStringContentLength%2A> = 8192
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxArrayLength%2A> = 16384
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxBytesPerRead%2A> = 4096
- <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxNameTableCharCount%2A> = 16384
## Examples The following example shows how to get the ReaderQuotas object.
[!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#11](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ne_0_1.cs)]

remarks.format:

[!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ne_11_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether transactions should be flowed to the service.
Docs.value: if the clientâ€™s transactions should be flowed to the service; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:

## Examples The following example shows how to get the value of TransactionFlow the binding.
[!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#14](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ne_7_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the transactions protocol used by the service to flow transactions.
Docs.value: The used by the service to flow transactions. The default protocol is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WS-Atomic Transaction protocol can also be used by setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionProtocol.WSAtomicTransactionOctober2004%2A> value.
## Examples The following example shows how to get the TransactionProtocol object.
[!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#15](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ne_29_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the service configured with the binding uses streamed (in one or both directions) or buffered modes of message transfer.
Docs.value: The value that indicates whether the service configured with the binding uses streamed (in one or both directions) or buffered modes of message transfer. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks It is possible to stream only the incoming or the outgoing messages by specifying, respectively, <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransferMode> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransferMode>.
## Examples The following example shows how to get the TransferMode.
[!code-cs[S_UENetNamedPipe#18](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.ne_14_1.cs)]
